snippet.textOriginal: I think the difficulty comes from just not playing for awhile, relearn the combat and parry

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm a fan of the souls saga, I've done between 100 and 300 runs in each dark souls with various builds (even on bloodborne), about twenty on elden ring + dlc lasting between 40 and 80 hours, I finished elden ring in 1.0 as soon as it came out, long before the nerf patches on all the bosses and also the first version of the elden ring dlc including radan obviously, I also did about ten runs on sekiro, and all always finished without summons or various tricks, but only using weapons, shields, rings and healing. I finished Lies of P the same way 2 times and the third time I did it from scratch to play the DLC in NG, and I can say after finishing it this morning that the DLC is very unbalanced compared to when you can enter it and it has the same problem of the system being a bit too much on trial and error with the parry especially with the bosses, where you have to be very precise with the milliseconds otherwise you don't make the perfect parry and you take damage, after finishing the DLC doing the final boss "without doing what" you know who knows, I confirm that it is the biggest piece of shit I have ever seen in terms of gameplay, the gameplay problems on the combat have been exacerbated even more than the base game where they were already exhaustive, at least on Eden Ring reflexes count, while here memory is much more important, in fact it is enough to see that very strong people on Elden Ring have done many bosses of the DLC on the first try while on the Lies of P DLC practically no one has succeeded "from what I have seen around" and ask yourself why, it is uselessly difficult and frustrating with the bosses and also a bit with the basic enemies but already better than the bosses, if instead of wanting to make the stuff artificially difficult and they lowered the damage by 20% it would have been much more balanced and fair but it is clear that they aimed to make this great jumble of badly made bosses and with fast attacks but badly done to make them as difficult as possible, let's remember the old one on sekiro that was very fast but anything but badly done and extremely less punitive, but anyway not a simple boss fight but precisely balanced.

the story is magnificent and it took me a lot, truly exceptional in the narration and in the characterization of the characters especially 1 that you all already know.

if you want to play it and you haven't played other souls or similar stop while you still have time because this dlc is not for you, but as a lover of the genre it has been played, but I warn you that all the madonnas will fall together with every crucifix within a radius of 50 meters, trust me maybe wait for it to make it a little easier if it ever does, for the most part they are all recycled assets apart from something but little stuff

in conclusion it is the biggest bullshit I have ever seen needlessly punishing and difficult on an artificial level but the story is very cool and worth a lot (but only the story let's be clear)

-I almost forgot about the difficulty selector that actually makes it more accessible but anyway the problems already explained before in the speed of the attacks of the bosses and many enemies make the difficulty excessive anyway precisely because the problem is not only in the damage but in the gameplay

-I add to the comment that I think that a story like this really touches the heart especially towards the end of the dlc not to mention the music especially one in particular that those who know have already understood which one, something to remember with a tear running down your face
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm a fan of the souls saga, I've done between 100 and 300 runs in each dark souls with various builds (even on bloodborne), about twenty on elden ring + dlc lasting between 40 and 80 hours, I finished elden ring in 1.0 as soon as it came out, long before the nerf patches on all the bosses and also the first version of the elden ring dlc including radan obviously, I also did about ten runs on sekiro, and all always finished without summons or various tricks, but only using weapons, shields, rings and healing. I finished Lies of P the same way 2 times and the third time I did it from scratch to play the DLC in NG, and I can say after finishing it this morning that the DLC is very unbalanced compared to when you can enter it and it has the same problem of the system being a bit too much on trial and error with the parry especially with the bosses, where you have to be very precise with the milliseconds otherwise you don't make the perfect parry and you take damage, after finishing the DLC doing the final boss "without doing what" you know who knows, I confirm that it is the biggest piece of shit I have ever seen in terms of gameplay, the gameplay problems on the combat have been exacerbated even more than the base game where they were already exhaustive, at least on Eden Ring reflexes count, while here memory is much more important, in fact it is enough to see that very strong people on Elden Ring have done many bosses of the DLC on the first try while on the Lies of P DLC practically no one has succeeded "from what I have seen around" and ask yourself why, it is uselessly difficult and frustrating with the bosses and also a bit with the basic enemies but already better than the bosses, if instead of wanting to make the stuff artificially difficult and they lowered the damage by 20% it would have been much more balanced and fair but it is clear that they aimed to make this great jumble of badly made bosses and with fast attacks but badly done to make them as difficult as possible, let's remember the old one on sekiro that was very fast but anything but badly done and extremely less punitive, but anyway not a simple boss fight but precisely balanced.

the story is magnificent and it took me a lot, truly exceptional in the narration and in the characterization of the characters especially 1 that you all already know.

if you want to play it and you haven't played other souls or similar stop while you still have time because this dlc is not for you, but as a lover of the genre it has been played, but I warn you that all the madonnas will fall together with every crucifix within a radius of 50 meters, trust me maybe wait for it to make it a little easier if it ever does, for the most part they are all recycled assets apart from something but little stuff

in conclusion it is the biggest bullshit I have ever seen needlessly punishing and difficult on an artificial level but the story is very cool and worth a lot (but only the story let's be clear)

-I almost forgot about the difficulty selector that actually makes it more accessible but anyway the problems already explained before in the speed of the attacks of the bosses and many enemies make the difficulty excessive anyway precisely because the problem is not only in the damage but in the gameplay

-I add to the comment that I think that a story like this really touches the heart especially towards the end of the dlc not to mention the music especially one in particular that those who know have already understood which one, something to remember with a tear running down your face

snippet.textDisplay:
Yeah, they expanded the lore, by making it even more confusing... 

- WHO is the Madman who wrote the Madman's Journal??? He directly talks about the maid puppet wanting the child and that he's going to try and get the child himself... WHICH CHILD... Carlo? 
- Rosaura is described as 'the key'... The key to what???? Why did Markiona need her? 
- The Order stole the Arm of God from the Charity House. That would be fine, except Valentinus had already given it to the church by then. What, did he take it back to the charity house, and THEN Simon came and took it, and THEN Archbishop Andreus got Cecile the Nun to go and steal it back AGAIN? 
- Why are there two Camille's? (Geppetto's wife, and the Maid Puppet). The lore with this DLC said that Markiona placed the heart of her loved one inside the maid puppet, so it can't be Geppetto's wife's ergo... What the hell... Why give two characters the same name?

The gameplay was great, don't get me wrong, but blimey. They tried to close off a couple of character arcs (Romeo and the Legendary Stalker) and we ended up with more unanswered questions. Story feels really rushed to me.
snippet.textOriginal:
Yeah, they expanded the lore, by making it even more confusing... 

- WHO is the Madman who wrote the Madman's Journal??? He directly talks about the maid puppet wanting the child and that he's going to try and get the child himself... WHICH CHILD... Carlo? 
- Rosaura is described as 'the key'... The key to what???? Why did Markiona need her? 
- The Order stole the Arm of God from the Charity House. That would be fine, except Valentinus had already given it to the church by then. What, did he take it back to the charity house, and THEN Simon came and took it, and THEN Archbishop Andreus got Cecile the Nun to go and steal it back AGAIN? 
- Why are there two Camille's? (Geppetto's wife, and the Maid Puppet). The lore with this DLC said that Markiona placed the heart of her loved one inside the maid puppet, so it can't be Geppetto's wife's ergo... What the hell... Why give two characters the same name?

The gameplay was great, don't get me wrong, but blimey. They tried to close off a couple of character arcs (Romeo and the Legendary Stalker) and we ended up with more unanswered questions. Story feels really rushed to me.

snippet.textDisplay:
- focus on events prior to the base game
- explore a different reincarnation of an already existing location
- second location is a research facility 
- major area of the dlc is a fishing village 
- human-beast hybrid boss with 2 cutscenes, 1 health bar, and 2 phases rewards a melee weapon with ranged attacks

- Hunters / Stalkers
- Blood / Ergo
- Church / Alchemists
- Horrible experiment monsters / Horrible experiment monsters
- Exact blocking ability to restore health if you miss a perfect brink guard

Straight up derivative Bloodborne  and Old Hunters copy cat. Not even trying to hide it.

snippet.textDisplay: I entered the DLC in a NG+3 with a 225 level character. I am used to the NG+ damage in normal enemies and bosses. Even with that experience, I had to level down the difficulty in the alligator fight because I got stucked for almost 3 days in that arena (one o two missed blocks or parries were enough to send me back to the Savana experience center ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜¢) and with such an unpredictable hitting enemy it was starting to feel unfair even if I was so focused on learning his moveset. Even with that adjustment, the fight did not get easier, only more forgiving (and I have to admit that it felt more fair) I went back to the standard difficulty for the next area and it has been very difficult but that is ok (I am probably going to get wrecked by Markiona, right? ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜‚) All this is to say that difficulty is enhanced by the damage taken by any hit and, even as a soulsborne veteran, I have to admit there is no shame in tuning down the difficulty.
snippet.textOriginal: I entered the DLC in a NG+3 with a 225 level character. I am used to the NG+ damage in normal enemies and bosses. Even with that experience, I had to level down the difficulty in the alligator fight because I got stucked for almost 3 days in that arena (one o two missed blocks or parries were enough to send me back to the Savana experience center ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜¢) and with such an unpredictable hitting enemy it was starting to feel unfair even if I was so focused on learning his moveset. Even with that adjustment, the fight did not get easier, only more forgiving (and I have to admit that it felt more fair) I went back to the standard difficulty for the next area and it has been very difficult but that is ok (I am probably going to get wrecked by Markiona, right? ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜‚) All this is to say that difficulty is enhanced by the damage taken by any hit and, even as a soulsborne veteran, I have to admit there is no shame in tuning down the difficulty.

snippet.textDisplay:
This DLC was garbage. 

Extremely short, areas were bland and boring, very few big good boss fights and just an overall disappointment. 

Weapons were decent! Outfits were terrible and most reused like black rabbit ones. 

Waste of money. Hard to justify it being half the price of the base game when itâ€™s a fifth or fourth the size of the base game. 

Base game one of my favourites! This garbage not so much.

(Difficulty was not hard compared to base game. Complaining about difficulty is silly)

snippet.textDisplay: Just finished the plat on the dlc last night on NG+5. Itâ€™s really not much harder than the main game even on multiple NG+ where itâ€™s even more difficult. Same thing happened with Shadow of The Erdtree. People jumped back in after not playing for a while and assumed it was just too hard. I really hope they donâ€™t turn difficulty down. I mean they already added 2 lower difficulty modes on top of it. I refuse to believe anyone who played the main game thinks the difficulty is too much on the new Very Easy Mode difficulty. That is insane. And if people refuse to put it on an easier difficulty and are still complaining, thatâ€™s really a you problem. Lol. Your pride and refusal to leave legendary mode doesnâ€™t warrant a campaign for the developers to lower difficulty for everyone. And the devs said theyâ€™re lowering it already coming up. Which is a shame. Like no one complains about Bloodborneâ€™s The Old Hunters dlc which is a huge ramp up in difficulty. Same for DS3. The dlc is supposed to be harder. Not just the same as the main game. If you just finished a full run of the main game or even to Chapter 9 to access it, youâ€™re going to shred it. Especially if you set it down to very easy which I hear is a cakewalk in comparison and a lot less hard than the main game.

Your pride and refusal to leave legendary mode doesnâ€™t warrant a campaign for the developers to lower difficulty for everyone. And the devs said theyâ€™re lowering it already coming up. Which is a shame. Like no one complains about Bloodborneâ€™s The Old Hunters dlc which is a huge ramp up in difficulty. Same for DS3. The dlc is supposed to be harder. Not just the same as the main game. If you just finished a full run of the main game or even to Chapter 9 to access it, youâ€™re going to shred it. Especially if you set it down to very easy which I hear is a cakewalk in comparison and a lot less hard than the main game.

snippet.textDisplay: Lies of P was a perfect soulslike experience to me.... just absolutely refined to perfection. The introduction of difficulty levels is kinda lame, because it makes the trophies worthless....if not for that, I wouldn't mind in the slightest. I can't comment on Overture yet.

snippet.textDisplay: Amazing review but i disagree with some things. Much of the complains in this reviews are positive things. They hit like a truck because in this part of the game you know how to parry. Also the distance between checkpoints are really short and not that far away like the review said. Good story, amazing music and very responsive gameplay (9.5 for me)
